article.details:
Sketching, painting and printing have been the conventional ways of visualizing one’s perceptions. But at Kurukshetra, dare to dream beyond all these – Dare to create! Creation is the most complex magic g
in real life. Watch it come alive before your eyes at K14! Experience being the creator by creating 3D
objects of virtually any shape from just digital models.
Here is your chance to create your own world as you learn the basics of 3D printing. Kurukshetra 2014
presents the 3D printing workshop, which will help you transform your visualization into reality - quite
literally.
Each participant will walk away with a broad spectrum understanding of 3D printing technology, related
tools and materials and a greater sense of how this technology can be used commercially. By the end of
the day every participant will have a takeaway 3D printed model created all by themselves.
3D printing is the latest thing in town and make sure you are a pioneer of this new technology!

Being a pioneer is not new to Kurukshetra for it has always been in the frontline when
it comes to undertaking any first-of-its-kind initiative. One such is Krithi, a workshop
exclusively for school students of standards 9,10 and 11. Kurukshetra workshops cater to
enthusiastic minds of every age group and true to that, Krithi has been triumphant in giving
students from schools across the country, a taste of engineering with innovative themes like
Trebuchet modelling, Ornithopter Designing and Automata Building in its previous editions.
This year Krithi is sure to keep you hooked with a new technology with a whole new look.
Watch this space for more updates!

Nickelodeon Robot Wars is a game show that aired on Nickelodeon from August 25, 2002 to October 6, 2002. Hosted by Dave Aizer, the show was Nickelodeon's take on Robot Wars, the popular and long-running robot-fighting game show. The show was canceled after one season, and subsequently aired on Nickelodeon GAS. The series of six shows was filmed at Shepperton Studios in England in January 2002 at the same time as the second season of the Robot Wars Extreme Warriors series shown on 'The New TNN' American television network (now Spike TV). Both shows featured American teams and robots flown to England for the filming.

It is a holy place and is also known as Dharmakshetra ("Holy Place"). According to the Puranas, Kurukshetra is named after King Kuru, the ancestor of Kauravas and Pandavas, as depicted in epic Mahabharata. The importance of the place is attributed to the fact that the Kurukshetra War of the Mahabharata was fought on this land and the Bhagavad Gita was preached on this land during the war when Lord Krishna found Arjuna in a terrible dilemma.
